learning_outcomes.description: Understand how various services work within the Australian Drug and Alcohol Policy context
Apply ethical and evidence based practices to the screening/assessment and treatment of substance use disorders, including comorbidity
Recognise and understand the actions of a range of licit and illicit substances (appearance and terminology)
Critically evaluate AOD resources and apply them to specific audiences (e.g., clients of an AOD service, staff members, family members)

assessments.assessment_title: Experience and treatment of a comorbidity
assessments.task_description: Students will select a client with a specific comorbidity (for example, social phobia + alcohol use; schizophrenia + cannabis use) and will write a maximum 2000 word essay on the experience and treatment of this client, drawing on information from the comorbidity literature. Further details will be provided in class.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online via Turnitin. Please keep a copy of your submission receipt.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Present Critical review of AOD resource
assessments.due_date:
16/09/2024

Student will present during the scheduled class time in Week 9.
assessments.task_description: Working independently students will present for up to 8 minutes about ONE of the 2 AOD resources they selected to critically review, and how to apply them to specific audiences (e.g., clients of an AOD service, staff members, family members). There will be Q&A after each presentation.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Written Critical review of AOD resource
assessments.task_description: Self-directed learning task, in which students will select read/watch 2 AOD resouces, critically review them using the suggested criteria, and consider how they might use the resource with specific clients or AOD service settings.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online via Turnitin. Please keep a copy of your submission receipt.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
